none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on August 19, 2013 Description from Terminal Escape:
Bombastic and chaotic madness of the highest caliber. Vocals are practically thrown out of the singer's mouth as if the words themselves are a horrible entity from which he is trying to free himself, while the low end is a constant and terrifying death knell. South Korea's SCUMRAID capture a primitive intensity missing from a lot of Noise Not Music bands, you get the impression that this isn't an act, that the distortion of sound and thought is an actual manifestation of the world as seen through these six eyes.Â  SCUMRAID They appear to be every bit as powerful live as this demo suggests. The tape is sold out, but find the band here.
//3.bp.blogspot.com/-E_BHBRNBd2w/UhI5nUkOtXI/AAAAAAAAIcU/g-0XUxE7uj0/s1600/scumraid+cover+copy.jpg //4.bp.blogspot.com/-qf8TyL8SAJY/UhI844ewU5I/AAAAAAAAIcg/RxmbUlIlL7Q/s1600/scumraid+img+copy.jpg //www.youtube.com/watch?v=IIETwRx9ZLw&fmt=22 https://www.facebook.com/scumraid

seo.title: Scumraid - Scumraid demo 2012 - Terminal Escape
